poem.title: If It Please Your Honour
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Guilty pleas are easy But when a man pleads not guilty The counsel for the prosecution preens: It's story time. Can the accused deny that every Wednesday in Lent He pees in the soup to peals of mirth from his delinquent peers? The defendant can and does: The peas in the soup are as in fog Where evidence is murky Where even silks are sulky. He peels his cataracted lenses and peers in.
